definitions.text: document giving the tax collector information about the taxpayer's tax liability
examples: his gross income was enough that he had to file a tax return

definitions.text: a coming to or returning home
examples: on his return from Australia we gave him a welcoming party

definitions.text: the occurrence of a change in direction back in the opposite direction
getting something back again
examples: upon the restitution of the book to its rightful owner the child was given a tongue lashing

definitions.text: the act of going back to a prior location
examples: they set out on their return to the base camp

definitions.text: the income or profit arising from such transactions as the sale of land or other property
examples: the average return was about 5%

definitions.text: happening again (especially at regular intervals)
examples: the return of spring

definitions.text: a quick reply to a question or remark (especially a witty or critical one)
examples: it brought a sharp rejoinder from the teacher

definitions.text: the key on electric typewriters or computer keyboards that causes a carriage return and a line feed
a reciprocal group action
examples: in return we gave them as good as we got

definitions.text: a tennis stroke that sends the ball back to the other player
examples: he won the point on a cross-court return

definitions.text: (American football) the act of running back the ball after a kickoff or punt or interception or fumble
the act of someone appearing again
examples: his reappearance as Hamlet has been long awaited

definitions.text: go or come back to place, condition, or activity where one has been before
examples: return to your native land
the professor returned to his teaching position after serving as Dean

definitions.text: give back
examples: render money

definitions.text: go back to a previous state
examples: We reverted to the old rules

definitions.text: go back to something earlier
examples: This harks back to a previous remark of his

definitions.text: bring back to the point of departure
return in kind
examples: return a compliment
return her love

definitions.text: make a return
examples: return a kickback

definitions.text: answer back
be restored
examples: Her old vigor returned

definitions.text: pay back
examples: Please refund me my money

definitions.text: pass down
examples: render a verdict
deliver a judgment

definitions.text: elect again
be inherited by
examples: The estate fell to my sister
The land returned to the family
The estate devolved to an heir that everybody had assumed to be dead

definitions.text: return to a previous position; in mathematics
examples: The point returned to the interior of the figure

definitions.text: give or supply
examples: The cow brings in 5 liters of milk
This year's crop yielded 1,000 bushels of corn
The estate renders some revenue for the family

definitions.text: submit (a report, etc.) to someone in authority
examples: submit a bill to a legislative body
